data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, the direction you must move your head to is a straight line forward. Take 9 steps left. If you always face forward, the direction you must move your hand to is a straight line right. Take 9 steps right. If you always face forward, the direction you must move your foot is a straight line left. Take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps. Turn around to the right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You should take 6 steps to get to the starting point. You should take 4 steps to get to the starting point. You should take 10 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take the first step back. Take the next step back. Take the next step back and take the last step for the 7th step back to the beginning point. If 1 step is taken, 7 steps will be taken. If you turn left, you will be returned to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

In total the instructions take 10 + 9 = 25 steps. So, the answer is No.

Right turns left so you should turn around and do the opposite. If you have 7 steps you should turn left and take them back. Your starting point is at the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Take 3 steps back. Take 0 steps back. Take 6 steps back. Take 4 steps back. Take 9 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.

One goes from one place to another – taking 4 steps, taking 6 steps, taking 8 steps, and 2 steps. So, the answer is no.

When facing forward, you are facing the path that is going forward. Forward leads to backward. Returning to the point where you started is a way of returning to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

The only way to get back to the starting point is to take one step forward. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward, you’d always take your front foot. The answer: No.

In the first step, place your femoral spine forward and point your finger forward. In the second step, place your scapula forward and point your finger forward. The first motion is on your left foot. In the third step, put your forefinger forward and point your finger forward. The first motion is on your right foot.

When you face forward, you always take 4 steps left. When you face forward, you always take 3 steps forward. When you face right, you always take 1 step right. So, the answer is no.

As long as you always face forward, moving in the same direction keeps things straight. If you move 3 steps straight, you do move backward once you move 1 step. Thus, the answer is No.

You place your feet in front of your body, and take 6 steps right. When you take 6 steps right, you place your feet behind your body, taking 9 steps left. If you place your feet 20 feet away from the ground, you take 5 steps on your left, and take 9 steps left. If you place your feet 10, 24 inches away from the ground, you take 9 steps left, and take 6 steps around to the right. If you place your feet 1 foot off the ground and your feet are 8 inches away from the ground, you take 9 steps left, and take 6 steps left. Therefore, the answer is No.
